intro: Glochidion malingheense, commonly known as the Malingheen glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the island of Mindanao. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short peduncles. Glochidion malingheense is typically found in lowland forests and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
